chapter.title: Installation of the Enterprise Version redborder Manager
chapter.para: Thanks to the installation wizard, the Manager can be configured and prepared quickly and easily without the need for specific Linux programming knowledge.

For the Manager installation, the user will have an ISO image obtained via download or through DVD facilitated by redborder. If the image was obtained via download, you can download it to your local disk or save it to a DVD or USB to be installed on a physical machine. In any case, once the first phase of installation is done, the system will restart and will boot up from the default option: Select from local disk.
Upon booting up, the installation wizard will have access to a menu with the following options:

listitem.para: Install Manager: launches the Managr installation menu.

Install Sensor: this option allows you to install the appropriate sensor for its subsequent registration in the redborder Manager.
Depending on the solution acquired, the menu will show the different options for the installation and registration of the sensors of the different Apps in the Manager: IPS (App IPS), Instagram or Twitter (App Social), MailGateway, Endpoint or ProxyHTTP (Malware App).

Rescue installed system: rescue start mode for cases where your machine has problems starting (advanzed mode). It also allows you to start the process of resolving the problem or changing the user password if it has been lost.
Boot from Local Drive: boot up from the local disk (by default).
Memory Test: memory test available for the system installation. If a memory module is defective, this test will detect it and will advise the user.

note.title: Note
note.para: Cluster Creation: it is advisable to revise the machine's memory before starting the installation of the second Manager.

textobject.phrase: Main screen of the redborder Manager installation wizard

caption.para: Main screen of the redborder Manager installation wizard

chapter.para: The installation process of the Manager will be carried out in two steps:

listitem.para: Basic settings and installation of the packets:
a) Lanaguage selection
b) Keyboard selection
c) Enter password
Completion of the Manager installation:
a) Network configuration
b) System configuration

chapter.para: Select Install Manager to begin the installation process of the Manager. Below, a series of basic configurations is explained.

section.title: Manager installation process: basic settings
section.para: Select the language in which you would like to operate from now on.
Choose the type of keyboard you would like to use during the process. Due to its broad compatibility, the American [US] keyboard option is selected by default.
1) Choose and enter a password: This will be the key that you will use from now on. It can be changed at any time.

2) Confirm password: Enter the password again to verify that you have entered it correctly without any typographical errors. If the password strength is low, the program will notify you in a pop-up window.

You can choose to enter a stronger password or save the current password and change it at a later time by selecting option 3) Password, accesible from the Mangaer Configuration menu (redBorder Configuration Menu).

note.title: Nota
note.para: Remember that the password selected in this step will be the password used to access the redborder web platform.

section.para: Once you have entered your Password selected the OK option, the system will create the partitions and install the wizard packets in your hard drive.

para.emphasis: Installation of the packets and restarting the system

section.para: Once you have entered the password, the wizard will install the packets in the hard drive.
Wait until the progress bar indicates that the installation has finished 100%. This process may take a few minutes.
Do not press any keys or perform any actions until the process has finished completely:

Once the packets are installed, the program executes the last scripts to finish the step. Then, a pop-up window will appear which requests that the system be restarted to finish the first part of the installation. Click on Reboot.

section.title: Complete the redborder Manager installation: redBorder Configuration menu
section.para: After the automatic system restart, we see the next screen which we will log into using the user root:

textobject.phrase: Completion of the installation process: login

caption.para: Completion of the installation process: login

note.title: Note
note.para: In order to install the Manager, it is necessary to log in with the user that has the most permissions: root.

section.para: For better security, we recommend that you assign three levels of users/ permissions betwen the people that will be in charge of the Manager.

para.emphasis: Levels of users for the redborder Manager

listitem.para: root: has all permissions. It is the super-administrador of the system.
admin: user that only has access to the system configuration menu, but does not have permissions ot modify files.
redborder: this user has a different meaning for the Manager than for the sensors.
-manager: user used for the registration of sensors.
-sensor: user used when the Manager wants to communicate with the sensors.

section.para: Next the following actions will be taken:

listitem.para: Password
rb_sysconf Command

section.para: Enter password. This is the password that you entered in the first stage of basic settings.
Enter rb_sysconf command
Execute the command rb_sysconf to launch the redBorder Configuration menu.

textobject.phrase: Completion of the installation process: enter rb_sysconf command

caption.para: Completion of the intallation process: enter rb_sysconf command

section.para: These are the options that you will find on the main screen of this menu:

listitem.para: System Configuration: configuration of the hostname, Manager IP, time and state of the Manager.
Network Configuration: creation of bondings, segments, DNS, routes and IPMI. Remember that in order put the Manager in operation, at least two network connections are required.
Passwords: access this option if you want to change the passwords defined for each user role.

Backup System: allows for the creation of a recovery file, the possibility to restore the machine with a backup copy and a view of a list of the available backup copies and the possibility of uploading the said files to an FTP server.

section.para: w) start simple wizard: starts a wizard that will allow you to easily and quickly install and configure the Manager.
q) quit: Salir. Returns us to the main system configuration screen.

textobject.phrase: Main screen of redborder configuration menu installtion wizard

caption.para: Main screen of redborder configuration menu installtion wizard

section.title: Installation of the redborder Manager with Simple wizard
section.para: To perform the automatic installation of the Manager, there is an option to: w)start simple wizard. This option facilitates the installation process of a Manager and the creation of a cluster for the union or two or more managers.

important.title: Important
important.para: The steps that will be followed here are those corresponding to the installation of the Manager from the beginning, with additional instructions for adding another Manager to a cluster.
If the Manager has already been installed, it will not be necessary to repeat the network connection. You will only have to connect the new Manager being added to the cluster.
>The user will be able to manually configure the rest of the system parameters with the selection option 1)System configuration in the redBorder configuration menu.

section.para: As you will see, there are different options defined by default. To accept them, you only need to press Enter. However, you can change them naually at any time during the installation process.

caption.para: Installation with simple wizard: enter Hostname, domain, primary DNS, secondary DNS and server NTP

listitem.para: Selected Mode: cluster. Select the cluster mode to join more than one Manager.
Insert Hostname [rbmanager]. The option defined by default is rbmanager. This is the name that clearly and simply identifies the Manager its position within the cluster.
Insert domain: [redborder.cluster]. Domain defined by default.
Insert Primary DNS. Value defined by default. The user can change it to indicate the server that provides the DNS to its network and to which the Manager will be associated.
Insert Secondary DNS (optional). Indicate secondary DNS (optional). It is recommended that an alternative DNS be entered to substitute the primary DNS in case of server error.

note.title: Note
note.para: It is recommended that different names be used for each one of the Managers being added to the cluster. Consecutive numbering is the most appropriate (e.g.:rbmanager01, rbmanager02), or a name which identifies the role (e.g.: rbmanagermaster, rbmanagerslave01, rbmanagerslave02).

section.para: Once these values have been entered, the system will notify that the changes have been applied successfully with the following message marked in green: DNS and domain settings applied successfully.

The next step to beging the bonding creation process is the indicate the NTP server: NTP server [pool.ntp.org]: If there are any NTP servers in your network, this must be indicated. Otherwise, one will be assigned by default.
Hereafter, the system will ask you to enter the management IP: Insert management IP address:

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: For the creation of a cluster the user must reserve two bondings: one for the network managemet (Management IP address) and another for the synchronism network (Sync IP address).

textobject.phrase: Configuring the Manager with Simple Wizard

caption.para: Installation of the Manager with Simple Wizard: enter the management IP of the Manager

section.para: To create a bonding, the elements indicated hereafter must be specified. To accept the defined values, simply press the Enter key. Otherwise, manually enter the new values.

para.literal: Insert default gateway for this management interface (Y/n):

listitem.para: The predetermined option appears in capital letters. Remember that if you want to add this gateway just press the Enter key.
If you want to enter a new gateway for this management interface, type n.

para.literal: Insert a route for this bonding (y/N)?:

listitem.para: Type y to enter a new route for the bonding.

section.para: Once these values have been entered, the system will notify that the bonding has been created successfully with the following message marked in green: Bonding 0 created successfully.

textobject.phrase: Bonding creation: insert the synchronism IP

caption.para: Manager Installation with Simple Wizard: Bonding creation and insertion of synchronism IP

para.emphasis: Creating a new synchronism bonding for adding a new Manager to the cluster

section.para: To create a new bonding we must indicate the IP and the synchronism network mask as well as a route for the new bonding.
Once these values have been entered, the system will notify that the bonding has been created successfully: Bonding 1 created successfully.
The following question will then appear: Would you like to join to another cluster (y/N)?, type y to continue with the process of joining a new Manager to the cluster.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: During the installation of the first Manager, the question Would you like to join to another cluster (Y/N)? does not apply, and so the option N will be defined by default.

textobject.phrase: Creation of synchronism bonding to add a Manager to the cluster

caption.para: Installing Manager with Simple Wizard: creating synchronism bonding to add a Manager to the cluster

section.para: At this point we must tell the system how the databases and data storage will be managed in the Manager. As can be seen in the screenshot,in all cases the option N is selected by default. It is thus recommended that the Manager perform this operation. Otherwise, select the option y for the following cases:
Would you like to use remote S3 storage? (y/N). Indicate if the Amazon Web Services (AWS) protocol is being used to transfer file.
Would you like to use remote memcached? (y/N). Select if you would like to perform chaching requests to databases.
Would you like to use remote postgresql database? (y/N). Managing with postgresql database.
Once the selected option has been indicated, we must confirm that we want to apply this configuration: Are you sure you want to apply this configuration? (y/N)
Select the option y.

caption.para: Installing Manager with Simple Wizard: database options

section.para: From now on, the installation of the selected services will be carried out. This process may take a few minutes. Once the instalation has been completed, the wizard will take you back to the main screen of the redborder configuration menu.
To exit the wizard, select the option q) quit.
To install a new Manager and add it to a cluster, select the option w) to launch the new installation wizard.

section.title: Installing and adding a new Manager to the cluster
section.para: To install a second Manager (if it is being installed at a different time than the master Manager) it is necessary to launch the ISO image again to iniciate the process; the first steps are identical to those described previously fot the installation of the Manager.

note.title: Note
note.para: In the main screen of the Manager installation wizard you will find the option Memory Test to be advisable to review the memory status of the machine before before starting the installation of the second Manager.

section.para: Select Install Manager to initiate the installation process.

textobject.phrase: Main screen of the redborder Manager installation wizard

caption.para: Main screen of the redborder Manager installation wizard

section.para: After configuring the basic settings and installing the packets, the system will restart automatically. Then Log in, enter Password and enter the command in rb_sysconf to access the main screen of the redborder configuration menu.

note.title: Note
note.para: The password that you select here can be different from that indicated for the first Manager. Using a single password is recommended to avoid confusion.

textobject.phrase: Installing a new Manager and adding it to the cluster

caption.para: Installing a new Manager and adding it to the cluster

section.para: Select the option w)start simple wizard to start the installation process of the second Manager. It is recommended that the default option be Selected Mode: cluster.

The installation process of this second Manager is identical to that employed for the installation of the master Manager. The configuration of the same elements can be observed on the following screens n the following screens:

listitem.para: Hostname
Domain
Primary DNS (may differ from the primary Manager)
Secondary DNS
NTP server

important.title: Important
important.para: It is important that different names for each of the Managers being added to the cluster be used. It is advisable to follow consecutive numbering (e.g.:rbmanager01, rbmanager02) or a name which identifies its role (e.g.: rbmanagermaster, rbmanagerslave01, rbmanagerslave02).

section.para: The next step is the creation of two bondings: management (bonding 0) and sychronism (bonding 1). Indicate (or select the value given by defualt) the following values:

listitem.para: (Management/sync) IP address
(Management/sync) Netmask
Gateway for the management interface (Default gateway for this management interface (Y/n)?:)
Route for the bonding (Insert a route for this bonding (y/N)?:)

section.para: Once theses values have been entered, the wizard will confirm that the bondings 0 and 1 have been created successfully: Bonding created successfully.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: The management networks of the first and second Manager as well as the that of the synchronism must have connectivity amongst them in order to be able to function as a cluster.
Cluster SYNC IP Adress (bond1): Enter as synchronism IP the same IP as the Master Manager.

textobject.phrase: Installing a new Manager and adding it to the cluster: bondings

caption.para: Installing a new Manager and adding it to the cluster: bondings

section.para: In this case, when asked: Would you like to join another cluster? (y/N); select the option y.
Next, the cluster synchronism IP must be entered: Cluster SYNC IP Adress (bond1): This corresponds to the synchronism IP (or bonding 1) of the first Manager or Master.

textobject.phrase: Enter the synchronism IP to add to the cluster

caption.para: Installing a new Manager and adding it to the cluster: enter the synchronism IP to add it to the cluster

note.title: Note
note.para: If the machine uses DHCP, these configurations will be performed automatically.

section.para: Before applying this configuration, select the mode in which the Manager will operate. On the following screen all available options can be seen:

textobject.phrase: Select services for each of the Managers

caption.para: Installing a new Manager and adding it to the cluster: select the mode of the new Manager

note.title: Note
note.para: If no option has been selected, the system will attribute the option 1) slave to the new Manager by default.
It is recommended that slave mode be selected (1) slave) to the new Manager since, this way, both Managers share services.

section.para: Congratulations! You have correctly installed the Enterprise Version of redborder Manager. From now on, you can configure and manage the Manager from the redborder web platform.
Read Chapter 3 "Installing and registering IPS/IDS sensors" to complete the installation process of the Manager and registration of the sensors.
